attributes.action: The state should purchase the M6 Toll Motorway and remove the tolls.
attributes.background:
The current private owners of the M6 Toll motorway have put the motorway up for sale. The road has never made a profit, loosing an average of £25M per year (source BBC).
The M6 Toll motorway is a vastly under-used national resource, which would be better added to the national state owned road stock

attributes.action: Stop using the unfair Carr-Hill formula to fund GP practices in England
attributes.background: GP funding is being changed using the fundamentally flawed Carr-Hill formula that does not take into account the diverse needs of different practices. It has also not been released in full so there is no accountability or transparency for the public.
attributes.additional_details: We petition the release of the Carr-Hill formula in full.Following the release of the formula we petition parliament to halt any changes to the way GP's are funded until a full public consultation within each NHS trust is carried out of the Carr-Hill formula as well as a risk assessment for GP practices to ensure the safety of patients in primary care.

attributes.action: Ensure everyone has access to TV and radio whilst staying in a UK NHS hospital.
attributes.background: Tonight I paid £25 for my dad to watch TV in hospital after an operation ...£25 for three days...I can afford to do it but realise many people can't. Hospital can be a worrying place...Surely as the 5th richest nation on earth we can allow people to watch the One Show etc. for free!

attributes.action: Make more affordable homes for larger families more 3/4 bed homed needed!
attributes.background: More affordable homes needed for larger families, build more affordable homes. We lack 3 but mainly 4 bedroom properties, with the amount of housing developments going up why do the government not encourage larger properties for families on these developments?
attributes.additional_details: Crawley council have stated to Crawley news paper that they only manage 260 4 bedroom properies with the demand being a lot higher for growing families then they can accommodate for and I'm sure with growing population this is an on going problem, not just locally but nationwide.

attributes.action: Instigate a National 'End of Life Wishes' Day via NHS, Councils, Schools, Homes
attributes.background: Family members should be given an opportunity to discuss & express their wishes re Resuscitation, End of Life Pathways, Palliative Care at Home or Hospice etc.  Family discussions involving the whole family.  Ensuring the management & personal needs of illness approaching death are respectfully met.
attributes.additional_details: Discussions surrounding End of Life wishes can be difficult, but, it may be made easier if you knew that someone in your street, was having a similar 'open & honest' conversation with their families.  Accessible    literature & forums may help to understand language like 'Power of Attorney' or the term 'DNACPR' (Do Not Attempt Cardio Pulmonary Resuscitation) etc

attributes.action:
Save our local pubs!
Increase the tax on shop-bought alcohol. Reduce it on pubs
attributes.background: Local pubs are gradually becoming a thing of the past and the part they play in the local community is also diminishing. The UK pub is an institution in it's own right and no politician to date has addressed it's decline. Cheap beer from supermarkets is threatening our traditions. Save the pub!!

attributes.action: Allow the peoples of the British Dependent territories to vote in EU referendum
attributes.background: Currently there is a petition to allow the British Dependances such as the Channel Islands to vote but not one for all the others such as the South Atlantic ones.
attributes.additional_details: In ICAT (fishing forum for the South Atlantic) St Helena is weakly under represented and we require the EU delegation for additional support in order to get favorable quotas. If Britain leaves the EU then without the EU delegation would be unlikely to support us.

attributes.action: Stop the renewal of the BBC charter allowing it to charge to watch live TV
attributes.background: When the charter was originally issued there wasn't much choice now, with digital television broadcasting, people can watch what they want but ONLY if they pay the BBC for the privilege. This is wrong, the BBC should be made to stand on it's own merit &, if necessary, should become subscription only

attributes.action: Make  the re-sale of event tickets, at more than 10% of their face value illegal
attributes.background: On numerous occasions I have tried to purchase tickets to various events, through official channels, only to find that the venue is sold out. However there are an abundance of tickets at inflated prices for sale. Some of these re-sale sites are openly supported by the official ticket sale sites.

attributes.action: Make a National Doctors' Day
attributes.background: Doctors provide care with altruistic values. Some countries like USA, India and Iran recognise their doctors with a special day. Such a day would recognise doctors' contribution to society.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 1933, USA has been celebrating a national doctors' day on 9th May, signed in law by President George Bush in 1990. Iran recognises famous physician, Avicenna and celebrates his birthday as doctors' day. In UK, Such a celebration will help doctors build their self-esteem and create a binding relationship between doctors and their patients. 
It should not a national holiday but a day of celebration and acknowledgement in hospitals and GP surgeries, just like nurses day (12th May).

attributes.action: Education should be Free. Scrap University fees. Scrap & write off student loans
attributes.background:
Education is a right. It should be more accessible to everyone regardless of their backgrounds. Without Education society can never prosper.

Student loans should also be scrapped or written off. They charge too much interest.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/may/17/george-osborne-pledge-to-scrap-very-unfair-tuition-fees-comes-to-light

attributes.action: Compulsory educational visits to The battle of the Somme and Churchill's bunkers
attributes.background: I feel that children have very little knowledge about the sacrifices soldiers made for our country and why we should always take time to remember them as a mark of respect. It should become part of the curriculum for history and geography.

attributes.action: Set up Brexit commission to advise on implications before Article 50 invoked
attributes.background: In the referendum campaign voters asked for the facts but with no historic precedent this left politicians free to say anything to secure votes.  The implications are now much clearer with some known facts to draw on. An independent commission will provide impartial advice before invoking Article 50

attributes.action: Hold a general election in 2017 under proportional representation
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum, political and economic chaos has thrown the UK into uncertainty. An unelected prime minister will be appointed and turmoil in party politics shows politicians to have a lack of value in democracy. FPTP is a dated mechanism and is not representative of the people.

attributes.action: Invoke The Treaty of Windsor to protect Portuguese in the UK and vice versa
attributes.background: In the spirit of mutual assistance contained within the “Anglo Portuguese Alliance” and with recent post Brexit extremist goading non UK citizens to leave I propose UK give special protection and rights to Portuguese within the UK  and the same protection be afforded to UK citizens in Portugal.
attributes.additional_details:
The Treaty of Windsor has been invoked by the UK on a numbers of occasions to protect the UK including two world wars & the Falklands campaign 
Treaty text of the extant alliance guaranteeing assistance refers: "the ally shall be bound to give aid and succour to the other, so far as he is able (without any deceit, fraud, or pretence) to the extent required by the danger to his ally’s realms, lands, domains, and subjects; and he shall be firmly bound by these present alliances to do this”

attributes.action: Allow Medicinal Cannabis (Savitex) for all neurological conditions in the UK.
attributes.background: The Welsh NHS have authorised the use of Savitex medicinal cannabis for MS sufferers only in Wales to treat muscle spasticity. However, there are many people in the UK with other neurological conditions such as Cervical Myelopathy and Myelomalacia who also suffer with severe muscle spasms.
attributes.additional_details: There is no magic cure for muscle spasms. There are certain medicines such as Gabapentin, Pregabalin, Baclofen ect but many patients do not benefit from them orally. To treat severe muscle spasms, many patients are offered the insertion of a Baclofen Pump instead. A recent cost analysis by the MS Foundation has found that it is cheaper to prescribe Savitex than insert and regularly maintain a Baclofen pump. Savitex trials have proved positive in reducing muscle spasms. Please support our campaign - it is cost effective. MS sufferers are allowed the drug why can't all people suffering with neurological conditions in the UK have access to it ?

attributes.action: Call a UK referendum on what our new relationship with Europe should be.
attributes.background:
A referendum is now required to clarify the position of the people of the UK with regards the pending  negotiation of the UK's future relationship with the EU. An outline proposal 
1: Tariff-based trade as non EEA member
2: EEA membership subject to EU rules
3: Full EU membership

attributes.action: Keep the United Kingdom inside the European Economic Area (EEA) and rejoin EFTA.
attributes.background:
-A supermajority of young people voted to remain inside the European Union
-We now know the consequences truly of voting to leave and Article 50 hasn't yet been triggered.
-Hundreds of thousands if not millions of Leave voters regret their decision
attributes.additional_details: We the undersigned pledge our support for the United Kingdom remaining a part of the EEA, which includes the EU alongside Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway. We pledge our support for rejoining the European Free Trade Agreement, which we established in 1960 and led until 1973. EEA member countries outside the EU participate in its single market but can also negotiate trade agreements freely and independently. We the British people would also continue to have de facto European Union citizenship.

attributes.action: Give all teenagers aged under 18 on 23.6.16 a vote in a supplemental referendum.
attributes.background: Allowing teenagers to vote in a supplementary EU referendum will be good for the future of Britain’s democracy, because whatever the final outcome they will have had the opportunity to participate in the decision. Their votes can be added to the June ballot and the result recalculated.

attributes.action: Referendum on the Terms of a Bill of Rights before Assent to Leave the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum set citizen versus citizen. The EU guaranteed Fundamental Rights. Hillsborough & Stafford show it was left to Citizens to enforce the most basic of Rights - to Life & for Justice. Government & MP's knew but failed - Year after Year. We cannot allowed such rights to be ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Leaving the EU requires a further treaty before Parliament. It should NOT BE passed without the fundamental rights of each UK citizen GUARANTEED first.

Mr Gove's plan is for a BILL OF RIGHTS to abolish the Human Rights Act when most citizens cannot enforce any current rights. 

RIGHTS TO BE TAKEN AWAY should be subject to REFERENDUM before the Act of Leaving. Limit their power to hurt YOU, your Family, & Fellow Citizens. SOVEREIGNTY means the MP is the servant and not the Master

Remind them.

attributes.action: A life-time ban from politics, and punishment, for MPs that renege on promises.
attributes.background: We propose a life ban from politics for MPs who do not enact all manifesto promises - or those implied in slogans.  Also a fine or imprisonment for 'perjury to abuse public trust'. Party funds used for such campaigns should be forcibly recovered to fund a watchdog body against future such abuses.
attributes.additional_details: Whatever you voted, the decision to leave the EU is a chance for Britain to fix its democracy.  In elections, and now in the referendum, politicians make campaign promises in order to win votes, only to u-turn or deny making those promises. It mocks the principles of democracy. Now is a chance to write into law an insurance against such deception. This law would put an end to 'career politics' and remind all elected representatives that they work for the electorate, not their own agendas.

attributes.action:
Brighton out of Britain.
Give Brighton and Hove its independence from Britain.
attributes.background: Brighton and Hove has long been a liberal land at odds with the country it resides in. This has been shown many times in our recent voting past. This has now again been highlighted in the recent brexit vote. We want to remain in Europe and continue to thrive in a time of globalisation.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cyclists to use cycle paths where provided
attributes.background: Cycle paths are created and funded for one sole reason, safety to cyclists and motorists, where provided it should be a legal requirement for cyclists to use the cycle paths to reduce danger to them and motorists on UK roads, especially those which are 60mph speed limits.

attributes.action: Get Washington out of Sunderland and back into County Durham council
attributes.background: Washington is in decline and Sunderland council still do nothing, why should the rest of the city be clean and Washington left out to waste away

attributes.action: Pass a law prohibiting or limiting referendums
attributes.background:
Parliament should pass a law either prohibiting referendums or requiring that the result that would change the status quo would need to achieve more than two-thirds of the votes cast to pass.

The current EU referendum demonstrates that too often they are - disruptive, divisive and distracting.
attributes.additional_details:
We live in a representative democracy. It is important that people have a say in their own government but it is equally important that we avoid a tyranny of the majority and that on particular issues voting proceeds on the basis of knowledge and understanding. Representative democracy, for all its flaws, achieves that goal better than any referendum can.

Meanwhile the referendum process distracts from other issues, falsely turns complex questions into binary choices and fosters division.

attributes.action: Install a shield in the Commons Chamber in memory of Jo Cox MP
attributes.background: Following the sickening murder of Jo Cox MP whilst serving her constituents, Parliament should move to install a shield -like the shield installed for Airey Neave- in the Commons Chamber.

attributes.action: Give domiciliary carers car maintenance funds per year.
attributes.background: I am carer in the community and my wages just about cover fuel and bills. I love my job but many of us carers cant pay for the wear and tear, that the daily usage is damaging our cars, by using it for up to 12hrs a day.
attributes.additional_details: I have found no extra help of funding/loans to help me get my car fixed and risk loosing my job

attributes.action: Make Grooming awareness classes compulsory in year 7 students timetables.
attributes.background: Grooming Gangs target young and vulnerable children.  This is more evident as the scandals are hitting the media headlines, like in Rotherham where 1400 girls were sexually exploited. Ever since more cases have come to light.  Young people need to be educated regarding this ongoing problem.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotherham_child_sexual_exploitation_scandal

attributes.action: Ban smoking on footpaths, walkways and public places
attributes.background: Passive smoking is becoming a serious health issue, specifically in urban area. Every morning, thousands of non-smokers have to face passive smoking while going to work as other people smoke on footpaths and walkways. A large number of people do not use designated smoking zones.
attributes.additional_details:
A quick look at this article from Cancer Research UK will tell us how dangerous passive smoking can be - http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/causes-of-cancer/smoking-and-cancer/passive-smoking

Unwanted passive smoking on the streets of major UK cities is causing health issues that are not very easy to detect in early stages. Overall, passive smoking is affecting the health of non-smokers living or working in urban areas in a significant way.

attributes.action: Increased pay for nurses, support workers and doctors in the NHS of 20% minimum
attributes.background: Last summer I was admitted to an adolescent psychiatric ward. My admission went on to last eight months and I have made tremendous progress in ways that I couldn't have foreseen in those first few days and months but I couldn't have done it without the incredible support network off staff!
attributes.additional_details: Less than a year on,i'm in college and aim to be back in full time education in September. I also have a part time job and I'm now providing for myself at 16 years of age. I am amazed at how the staff always responded calmly to fellow patients regardless of how much we might have tested their patience. I am inspired by their ability to stay calm in stressful situations. I appreciate the long and hard hours they put in to ensure other people's well being for a ridiculous excuse of a salary.

attributes.action: End all UK weapons sales to oppressive regimes.
attributes.background: The UK currently sells large quantities of weapons to countries that the Foreign Office recognises as having poor human rights records, including some that have even been accused of war crimes. Profit and political pandering to these regimes should not outweigh basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.amnesty.org.uk/yemen-conflict-uk-must-stop-selling-arms-saudi-arabia

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/britain-still-arming-israel-despite-fear-weapons-will-be-used-against-gaza-10357621.html

http://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/may/28/uk-weapons-sold-countries-poor-human-rights-saudi-arabia?CMP=Share_iOSApp_Other

https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2015/08/killer-facts-the-scale-of-the-global-arms-trade/

attributes.action:
Petition Minister of Health -
Establish Hospice Suites in NHS Hospitals
attributes.background: The current Office of National Statistics survey of End of Life Care, ‘Voices’, shows 96% of the dying strongly prefer home care or some more private and congenial place to die than the wards of a Hospital. Only 3% prefer Hospital yet half of deaths annually in England will occur on the wards.
attributes.additional_details:
Hospice care is the ‘centre of excellence’ for palliative care but most of us will die on the wards. We could have privacy, dignity and specialised care in Hospice Suites requiring reorganisation rather than more resources to establish.  

A recent Select Committee hearing had an NHS spokesman claiming this provision would reduce the skills of generalist Nurses and Doctors,  as if patients exist only to provide practical experience for medical staff. The dying should enjoy the best we can provide.

attributes.action: Veto Turkey's entry into the EU.
attributes.background: Recep Erdoğan's Turkey is a nation of deteriorating rights and authoritarian state harassment. Its GDP is half the EU average. It borders two war-zones. It uses the migrant crisis as blackmail and aggressively seeks prosecution for defamation outside of its borders. NO to Turkey's EU membership.
attributes.additional_details:
FREEDOM HOUSE: https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-world/2016/turkey

AMNESTY: https://www.amnesty.org/en/countries/europe-and-central-asia/turkey/

HUMAN RIGHTS WATCH: https://www.hrw.org/europe/central-asia/turkey

attributes.action: Reconsider the National Insurance banding for public sector employees.
attributes.background: In april 2016 the goverment implemented a rise in the national insurance banding affecting public sector workers including the armed forces, dentists and nurses where the banding has gone from a band D to a band A increasing 1.4% increase NI contributions equating to more than the 1 % payrise given
attributes.additional_details:
The decision for the increase was made in the 2013 budget. Since then the general rate of inflation has already increased

The impact of this rise was felt in receipt  of pay recieved for april where we recieved less than march because of this increase. 

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/pay-awards-for-over-a-million-public-sector-workers

https://www.unison.org.uk/news/press-release/2015/11/unison-says-national-insurance-increase-will-rob-public-sector-workers/

attributes.action: Remove hereditary peers from the House of Lords
attributes.background: The time has come to remove an outdated oddity from Parliament. There is no place for peers who gain their positions simply by being born into them. This is the logical step needed to finish the reforms of 1999.

attributes.action: Make schools provide more support for left handed children learning to write
attributes.background: Schools are equipped for right handed children. Items such as workbooks are not helpful. At such an important time in their development, not having specific support can knock their confidence. For example work books set out so that their writing hand is not covering the words they are copying.
attributes.additional_details: I have two left handed children and a left handed brother.  They struggle to use simple things because they live in a right handed world.

attributes.action: Change war pension deductions to benefits
attributes.background: Soldiers/veterans injured receive say £71.00 per week and claims ESA the DWP only allow £10 and take the rest away. This is compensation given due to injury and to have it removed when others on DLA are not effected or those on Universal Credits are not effected but those still on ESA suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
To The Rt Hon Stephan Crabb MP
 I would like to have the inconsistencies addressed for war disablement pension to be disregarded altogether as income as this is compensation awarded to the injured party and not a standard pension or income. All these issues have been addressed under the new universal credit scheme and is now left to a 'postcode lottery' as to whether our war veterans are put in hardship or not.

attributes.action: The U.K. To exit Europe and start its own trade federation.
attributes.background: Let's make Britain great again by exiting the EU and starting a new world trade federation. Let us show Europe how it should be done and at the same time make the new trade federation fair for all world nations to join including the developing nations.
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of giving handouts to developing nations let's create a trade federation that gives those nations their respect back and allows their economies to develop and flourish. 

Rule Britainnia!

attributes.action: Change to (CCRs) Regulations 2013 to an prevent online fraud
attributes.background: There is loop hole being exploited by a small number of online buyers, where if the seller cannot prove delivery (ie sent WITHOUT ONLINE TRACKING) the buyer claims non-delivery getting money back and the goods (theft). This is costing traders a small fortune in claims.
attributes.additional_details: What I propose is if the seller offers a tracking service and the buyer declines that service, then the risk should pass from the seller to the buyer (PROVIDING THE SELLER CAN PROVE DISPATCH. ie Royal Mail Certificate of posting) and no claims will be accepted for non-delivery. This will make no difference for goods damaged in transit claims.

attributes.action: Scrap the Severn Bridge tolls.
attributes.background: The government recently announced a cut to the Severn Bridge tolls after the bridges revert to public ownership in 2017.  This is not enough. This tax on trade and the local community should be removed particularly in light of the struggling economies of South Wales and the Forest of Dean.

attributes.action: Increase drink driving ban from a minimum of 12 months to a minimum of 24 months
attributes.background: Drink drivers are a bigger threat than terrorists. Some people seem to love taking risks. The majority of the time it's not the drink driver that gets hurt. 3,000 people a year on average are either killed or injured by a drink driver. Take the drink drivers off our streets for longer.

attributes.action: Stop HS2. Instead, invest in a more beneficial option such as UK ultraspeed.
attributes.background: HS2 is designed to be an engine for growth. It will cost £43 Billion. Maglev technologies are an excellent alternative to HS2 that will help to connect many more people within the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
- Maglev technology will allow travel from London to Glasgow via Birmingham, Manchester, Liverpool, Leeds, Teeside, Newcastle, Edinburgh and more, yet cost only £30BN
- Maglev trains travel at over 300mph compared to 170-200mph for conventional wheel on rail trains.
- Maglev trains are capable of faster acceleration/deceleration, can travel up steaper inclines, and the nature of the platform on which they travel means that they take 92% less land.

See http://www.500kmh.com/maps.html for more information on the original project. This is in no way affiliated with 500kmh.com, however, the site is an excellent source, clearly showing how the technology could benefit the UK.

attributes.action: Extra bank holiday for the Queen's birthday as we had an extra day in February.
attributes.background: As we had an extra day in February, I think we should get an extra bank holiday to help celebrate the Queens birthday on the 10th of June.

attributes.action: Allow transgendered people to begin hormone treatment from the age of 16.
attributes.background: Many people realise they are transgender in the early stages of their life but aren't allowed to begging transitioning into the opposite gender until the age of 18.

attributes.action: Re-introduce Capital Punishment for Terrorism
attributes.background: Since the attack on America on 9/11 2002 when some 3,000 innocent people were murdered there have been at least another 2,000 men, women and children cowardly murdered in addition to those murdered in Belgium today.
attributes.additional_details:
Enough is enough!

Tomorrow it could be you or I or your children or loved ones.

These cowards think that we are weak because we do nothing and whilst ever they believe this they will carry on slaughtering us.

By doing nothing we are in danger of losing the Freedom bought for us at such great cost twice in the last Century.  We must not betray the Sacrifice of those brave men and women who gave their lives for us to live in Freedom.

Those who bring, or would bring, death and destruction into our Homelands should also forfeit their lives in order to save innocent lives and we therefore humbly petition our Members of Parliament to re-introduce the death penalty for anyone found guilty of terrorist offences

attributes.action: Allow parents to supervise a child fishing without having to purchase a licence.
attributes.background: The current rules for fishing licence is that a child under 12 needs doesn't need a licence but if they of a young age and require help holding a rod the person helping has to have a licence or they can face a £2000 fine

attributes.action: Include Menstrual Cups and Reusable Sanitary Towels in Free Prescriptions.
attributes.background: why not prescribe diva/moon/menstrual cups or washable Sanitary Towels to the low income which would be covered under the free prescriptions right? it would be cheaper in the long run for the government and the diva cup is a lot more beneficial for your health.
attributes.additional_details:
A food bank has started a campaign urging the government to make tampons free after women confessed to using old socks, handkerchiefs, and even scrunched-up newspapers instead. - Fiona Rutherford Buzzfeed news.
“Most women confessed to regularly getting infections resulting in prescriptions for antibiotics and in some cases hospital treatment,” - Major Colin Bradshaw
#beggingforaTAMPON

attributes.action: Make the term "Engineer" a legally protected designation.
attributes.background: Engineering as a profession is popularly confused in the UK with such occupations as plumbers, mechanics and fitters. This gives it both a lower status than it deserves and an unwarranted gender bias. This results in the UK having the lowest proportion of females in engineering in the whole OECD.
attributes.additional_details:
There is already a severe shortage of graduate-level engineers and this is predicted to worsen. Many people are put off engineering at school, either because they (or their teachers) do not see it as a career for the academically gifted. In most of the developed world, it has a status closer to that of medicine and a correspondingly higher participation rate of females, ~30%, vs 7% in the UK.  

IPPR 2014: Women in Engineering (2014)
Professor John Perkins' Review of Engineering Skills (2013)

attributes.action: Increase Police funding to proactively tackle driveway car thefts.
attributes.background: Everyday you read about someone who has had their car stolen from their driveway. Police numbers have reduced to merely providing a reactive approach to this. Having your vehicle stolen is in inconvenient and unfair. We, (You) deserve better. Sign now to get this debated and funding increased.

attributes.action: We need more military personnel at least 500K to give use the security we need.
attributes.background: The UK has a strong but small army, we achieve many goals like defeating terrorist groups but with an army the size of just under 200,000 its hard to achieve all our goals. The recent issues of immigrants coming into the country just proves how much our border's are not protected completely.
attributes.additional_details:
This link shows our armed forces amount in the RAF, NAVY and ARMY, take a look you might be surprised.

http://www.globalfirepower.com/country-military-strength-detail.asp?country_id=united-kingdom

Many smaller countries have armies much bigger then ours and that says something. All the hard work of the British empire has been forgotten.
